title: Shootout in Delhi’s Dwarka Shared as Firing in Mumbai’s Ghatkopar
subtitle: Fact Check: A viral video on social media has been falsely shared as firing in Mumbai’s Ghatkopar area. Rather it is of a shootout that took place in Delhi’s Dwarka area.
author: www.thequint.com
vclaim:
A shootout took place between rival gangs near the Dwarka Mor metro station in South West Delhi on 19 May, police said, reported PTI. Following which, two suspected criminals were killed. Parveen Gehlot, who lived in Nawada area and Vikas Dalal had various cases of murders, robberies and extortion registered against them in Delhi and Haryana, the police added.

As per the police, the shootout took place because of a property dispute. It started at around 4 pm when people sitting in a black car opened fire on a white car. A senior police officer that fifteen rounds were fired that led to panic among the commuters in that busy area. The officer further said that Gehlot was sitting in his car when three men in another car stopped him and opened fire at him. Three rounds were fired at the criminals by the police officials who were in a PCR van. One of them was shot dead, he said.

Furthermore, two people who were involved in the shootout managed to escape. The police informed that they have identified them and are making the required efforts to nab them. A murder case has been registered at Bindapur police station, the officer said. He added that Dalal was on the run since 2018 as he had escaped from Haryana police's custody.
